author: Kai Mast
message:
Why not just one function that returns the path including the protocol and one excluding the protocol? 

I think the user never cares about the protocol. Also not on the web. So "www.kde.org" is much nicer than "http://www.kde.org". Doesn't matter to me if the site was received via HTTP or SPDY or some other way.

I also think that "prettyUrl" and "pathOrUrl" are really bad decisions for a function name. Its completely arbitary and doesn't describe what the function does at all.

replies.message:
I disagree about protocol. Even that it is even by Tim Berners Lee opinion that :// was terrible choice, it is still a important thing for user in means of sharing the address.

As copying a address is important to include http:// or https:// or even www. part, because sometimes without correct protocol and prefix, address is invalid.
